etymologies: mid 19th century: modern Latin, from Greek hurax ‘shrew-mouse’

definitions: a small herbivorous mammal with a compact body and a very short tail, found in arid country in Africa and Arabia. The nearest relatives to hyraxes are the elephants and other subungulates.

notes.text: Family Procaviidae and order Hyracoidea: three genera and several species

shortDefinitions: small herbivorous mammal with compact body and very short tail, found in arid country in Africa and Arabia
